page.title: 18 FARMING ( PAGE 1 )
page.content: Farm land covers most of the territory between North Lees and North Stainley. This being a distance of 2 and a half miles situated on the north side of Ripon. The majority of the land in this area is owned by the Ecclesiastical Commissioners who in their turn contract the land to individual farmers. { Middle Parks}Farm, which covers approximately 300 acres grows barley and wheat for cereal production. Also land is used for sheep grazing. The adjoining farm,{North Parks,} covers approximately 260 acres. Again most of the land is arable,growing barley and wheat. Cattle, reared for auction and grazing sheep are the stock content of this farm.
